content.description:
Ille1 agrestiumagrestis, -is, m.: farmer, country person trepidationetrepidatio, -onis, f.: alarm, trembling ignes relictos desertasque villas
per solitudinemsolitudo, -inis, f.: wilderness ardere in remediumremedium, -i, n.: cure, aid formidinis dictitabatdictito, -are: to repeat, keep saying.
Tum se quietiquies, -etis, f.: rest dedit et quievit verissimo quidem somno.
 1:refers to Pliny the Elder↩
content.question: Which of the following stylistic devices is found in line 3 (Tum...somno)?

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
